thread.title: Twitter reaction to Texas' upset of Oklahoma: Kevin Durant says 'Sorry NOklahoma'
thread.title_full: Twitter reaction to Texas' upset of Oklahoma: Kevin Durant says 'Sorry NOklahoma' | Dallas Morning News

author: SportsDayDFW.com
title: Twitter reaction to Texas' upset of Oklahoma: Kevin Durant says 'Sorry NOklahoma'
text:
Here's some national reaction from the Texas Longhorns' 24-17 upset over No. 10 Oklahoma. National reaction comes from fans, members of the media, as well as professional and former athletes.
@DanWeiner here pic.twitter.com/JDJ2i3gkVc
â” erin alyce (@herooine) October 10, 2015 Oklahoma City Thunder forward Kevin Durant, who went to the University of Texas, tweeted and deleted the above tweet.
Lol at how Kevin Durant can talk any amount of OU trash he wants right now and every one just has to nod and take it.
â” Royce Young (@royceyoung) October 10, 2015
It seems like those Texas players really like their coach.
— Stewart Mandel (@slmandel) October 10, 2015
Live look in at Texas fans https://t.co/iAI8pkU83a
— Jemele Hill (@jemelehill) October 10, 2015
The Eyes of Texas Are Upon You!!! ðŸ‚ðŸ’° https://t.co/lKWeJc68kv
— Quandre Diggs (@qdiggs6) October 10, 2015
Texas is looking good. Wonder if @LILBTHEBASEDGOD had anything to do with this. pic.twitter.com/rNg4UQD3Xu
— SI Extra Mustard (@SI_ExtraMustard) October 10, 2015
How you livin' Charlie Strong? pic.twitter.com/zKw0NZ2Baz
— Will Brinson (@WillBrinson) October 10, 2015
Great scene. So much happiness. Good for Charlie Strong & the Longhorns.
— Colin Cowherd (@ColinCowherd) October 10, 2015
Still support your Sooners ladies and gentlemen. No one feels worse than they do. Awful feeling.
â” Gabe Ikard (@GabeIkard) October 10, 2015 Good for Charlie Strong. Nothing against the Sooners, but happy for him. He does things the right way.
â” Mark Schlabach (@Mark_Schlabach) October 10, 2015 Flip side of the Texas rebound is yet another big loss for Oklahoma. Sooners have lost six times as a favorite in their last 14 games.
â” Pat Forde (@YahooForde) October 10, 2015 We welcome our newest signing to Sick-With-It Records...the Oklahoma Sooners
â” Jemele Hill (@jemelehill) October 10, 2015 Holy #Sooners Batman! There goes the season. #Longhorns pic.twitter.com/M8zeYbXcri
â” Mike Farrell (@rivalsmike) October 10, 2015 Happy for Longhorns fans. Itâ™s been a while since they had something undeniably great happen for their team, and then today happens.
â” Greg Tepper (@Tepper) October 10, 2015 Charlie Stormborn of House Strong, MOTHER OF LONGHORNS pic.twitter.com/vUxBb0VrzQ
â” Lost Lettermen (@LostLettermen) October 10, 2015 Amazing how effort and intensity cures everything at UT. Incredible great win for Strong. Crippled OU in the process. #Longhorns
â” Greg Bailey (@GregBailey13) October 10, 2015 Charlie Strong seems like such a good guy. I'm happy for him and Longhorns!
â” John McClain (@McClain_on_NFL) October 10, 2015 Text I just received... So what is my man Du'Vonta Lampkin thinking right in the #Oklahoma locker room? #Sooners #HookEm #Texas
â” Sean Adams (@thatsean) October 10, 2015 No quit in these #Sooners . Gotta love that if you're Team #BoomerSooner . This is how the #RedRiverShowdown should be. Blowouts are boring.
â” Damon Sayles (@DamonSayles) October 10, 2015 Great scene. So much happiness. Good for Charlie Strong & the Longhorns.
â” Colin Cowherd (@ColinCowherd) October 10, 2015 Will the real Baker Mayfield please stand up?
â” Sooners Blog (@uoklasports) October 10, 2015 As a born-and-raised Oklahoma football fan, it pains me to say I'm happy for Charlie Strong.
â” Skip Bayless (@RealSkipBayless) October 10, 2015 SOURCE: Oklahoma intentionally lost to Texas to ensure Charlie Strong would stay around for a while longer
â” NOT SportsCenter (@NOTSportsCenter) October 10, 2015 In a stunning turnaround, Texas upsets No. 10 #Oklahoma 24-17 http://t.co/VpiYoDlrD9 pic.twitter.com/ygT51u5TdJ
â” NBC Sports (@NBCSports) October 10, 2015 If Stoops breaks out same old "we got out worked, out played, out coached" b.s., I've got bail money for whomever punches him in the face.
â” Jordan Esco (@Jordan_Esco) October 10, 2015 That's 2 times in last 3 seasons Bob Stoops has choked away season with national title hopes to Texas team in disarray. Oy.
â” Lost Lettermen (@LostLettermen) October 10, 2015 2015 AT&T Red River Showdown Texas 24, Oklahoma 17
